TopicTitle: Memory leak when when in route to Moho or Eve (space travel)

Articles.Content:
Update: A I having a possible memory leak? And from what? I have been launching missions to Eve and Moho, but I keep noticing my ram usage increasing until 5gigs and then the game crashes. It's working like clockwork now...

Problem signature:

Problem Event Name: APPCRASH

Application Name: KSP.exe

Application Version: 4.6.4.63619

Application Timestamp: 55115266

Fault Module Name: KSP.exe

Fault Module Version: 4.6.4.63619

Fault Module Timestamp: 55115266

Exception Code: c0000005

Exception Offset: 0044b84a

OS Version: 6.1.7601.2.1.0.768.3

Locale ID: 1033

Additional Information 1: 56bb

Additional Information 2: 56bb07b878a5c7e549b914f8ef5604ab

Additional Information 3: ec72

Additional Information 4: ec723c194299c43e5c646fcb7e88140a

Read our privacy statement online:

http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=104288&clcid=0x0409

If the online privacy statement is not available, please read our privacy statement offline:

C:\Windows\system32\en-US\erofflps.txt

- - - Updated - - -

here is the crash report... Had another crash. Using following mods: Chatterer, MechJeb, Kerbal Alarm Clock, and Surface Lights (all are up to date and Surface Lights is not on my ship that is out trying to reach Moho and Eve).

https://www.dropbox.com/s/zrokgfehrlclpfx/output_log.txt?dl=0

Edited May 24, 2015 by mackadelik
Updated issue - memory leak

Took me a while to figure this one out. It's from a seemingly we'll know heat gauge memory leak : p. downloading the heat gauge mod that let's you hit F10 to show and hide the temp gauges fixed it!!! Haven't had a crash for an hour now. The mod is called temperature gauge killer.

Edited May 24, 2015 by mackadelik

Took me a while to figure this one out. It's from a seemingly we'll know heat gauge memory leak : p. downloading the heat gauge mod that let's you hit F10 to show and hide the temp gauges fixed it!!! Haven't had a crash for an hour now. The mod is called temperature gauge killer.

I am glad you solved your problem. Another easy solution is to disable PPFX in your video settings; without that enabled the heatgauges won't leak memory.

Thanks for the tip. I'm tempted to try it, but with the mod I guess I'm good either way. I haven't had a crash for so long that I can't remember when my last one was : )

Edited May 26, 2015 by mackadelik
